trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of acupuncture on lateral elbow pain compared to laser: a randomised controlled pilot study.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of acupuncture compared to sham laser on pressure pain threshold for lateral elbow pain in people aged 33 to 55.

interventions.interventions: acupuncture to the acupoints LI 10, LI 11, TE 5, LI4, ashi pt (all unilateral on side of pain) and GB 34(both sides) 2 x 20 minute sessions per week for 5 weeks (total 10 acupuncture sessions)
interventions.comparator: inactive laser to the acupoints LI 10, LI 11, TE 5, LI4, ashi pt (all unilateral on side of pain) and GB 34(both sides) 2 x 20 minute sessions per week for 5 weeks (total 10 sham, laser sessions)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pressure pain threshold at two acupoint sites (Large Intestine 10 and Large Intestine 11)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: One week prior to commencing intervention (week -1) At intervention commencement (week 0) At end of intervention phase (week 5) One month follow up assessment (week9)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH) questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One week prior to commencing intervention (week -1) At intervention commencement (week 0) Weekly (weeks 1,2,3,4,5) One month follow up assessment (week9)

One week prior to commencing intervention (week -1) At intervention commencement (week 0) On their fifth treatment (week 3) Completion of the intervention phase (week 5) One month follow up assessment (week9)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Chronic unilateral elbow pain (duration greater than 3 months)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Diseases of the central or peripheral nervous system Radial nerve entrapment Inflammatory rheumatic diseases Gout Radio-ulnar or radio-humeral arthritis Early episodes of lateral elbow pain treated with surgery or acupuncture Have a current work cover claim

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: PO Box 123 Broadway 2007 New South Wales

National Institute of Complementary Medicine (NICM) University of Western Sydney - Bldg 3 Campbelltown Campus
Locked Bag 1797 SOUTH PENRITH DC 1797 New South Wales

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a pilot study to evaluate whether acupuncture has any effect on lateral epicondyle "tennis elbow" pain as measured by pressure pain threshold and a disease specific questionnaire.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: University of Technology Sydney (UTS) Human Research Ethics Committee (HREC)
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: PO Box 123 Broadway 2007 New South Wales
